articles.headline: Trans-Pacific Partnership Supporters Pin Hopes on Lame-Duck Vote
articles.snippet: The certainty of Mr. Obama’s successor rejecting the agreement has T.P.P. advocates pushing for a vote before 2017.
articles.abstract: The certainty of Mr. Obama’s successor rejecting the agreement has T.P.P. advocates pushing for a vote before 2017.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The same harsh politics that have spawned obituaries for President Obama’s signature trade agreement between the United States and 11 other Pacific Rim nations could actually help win its ratification in Congress in a lame-duck vote late this year, advocates are hoping.

articles.headline: Automakers Still Selling Cars With Defective Takata Airbags
articles.snippet: New models from Toyota, Volkswagen, Fiat Chrysler and Mitsubishi are still being fitted with defective airbags and will need to be eventually recalled.
articles.abstract: New models from Toyota, Volkswagen, Fiat Chrysler and Mitsubishi are still being fitted with defective airbags and will need to be eventually recalled.
articles.lead_paragraph: At least four automakers — Toyota, Volkswagen, Fiat Chrysler and Mitsubishi — continue to sell new vehicles with defective Takata airbags that will need to be recalled, according to a Senate Commerce Committee report released on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Zen and the Art of Managing Smartphone Photos
articles.snippet: The healthiest approach to managing photos, it turns out, is a Zen one: to not deal with them much at all.
articles.abstract: The healthiest approach to managing photos, it turns out, is a Zen one: to not deal with them much at all.
articles.lead_paragraph: If your digital photos are a mirror of your life, they may also serve as a reminder that there is only so much you can control and that at some point you just need to let things go.

articles.headline: Uber Turns to Saudi Arabia for $3.5 Billion Cash Infusion
articles.snippet: The ride-hailing company said the investment by Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund was part of the most recent financing round that valued the company at $62.5 billion.
articles.abstract: The ride-hailing company said the investment by Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund was part of the most recent financing round that valued the company at $62.5 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In its quest to build a global empire, Uber has turned to the Middle East for its biggest infusion of cash from a single investor.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Silicon Valley Finds Trump’s Disruption Unwelcome
articles.snippet: There may be no love lost between Donald Trump and the tech world, but he is likely to need tech backers as his campaign turns to the general election.
articles.abstract: There may be no love lost between Donald Trump and the tech world, but he is likely to need tech backers as his campaign turns to the general election.
articles.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — Donald J. Trump would not be Silicon Valley’s first choice as president. Or its second. Or maybe even its third.

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton to Portray Donald Trump’s Foreign Policy Positions as Dangerous
articles.snippet: A speech will cast her likely Republican rival as a threat to bipartisan tenets of American diplomacy and declare him unfit for the presidency.
articles.abstract: A speech will cast her likely Republican rival as a threat to bipartisan tenets of American diplomacy and declare him unfit for the presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton plans to deliver a scorching assessment of Donald J. Trump’s foreign policy prescriptions on Thursday, casting her likely Republican rival as a threat to decades of bipartisan tenets of American diplomacy and declaring him unfit for the presidency.

articles.headline: Payday Loans’ Debt Spiral to Be Curtailed
articles.snippet: Protections are coming from a consumer agency that likens the lending to “getting into a taxi just to ride across town and finding yourself stuck in a ruinously expensive cross-country journey.”
articles.abstract: Protections are coming from a consumer agency that likens the lending to “getting into a taxi just to ride across town and finding yourself stuck in a ruinously expensive cross-country journey.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The payday loan industry, which is vilified for charging exorbitant interest rates on short-term loans that many Americans depend on, could soon be gutted by a set of rules that federal regulators plan to unveil on Thursday.

articles.headline: How Will ‘Brexit’ Vote Go? Monty Python May Offer Clue
articles.snippet: Underneath the campaign’s theatrics lie questions of identity: Have Britons, many of whom see the European Union as a money-sucking abstraction, ever felt like part of Europe?
articles.abstract: Underneath the campaign’s theatrics lie questions of identity: Have Britons, many of whom see the European Union as a money-sucking abstraction, ever felt like part of Europe?
articles.lead_paragraph: LIVERPOOL, England — Jackie O’Neill, a 54-year-old administrative assistant, was explaining the other day why Britain should vote to divorce itself from the European Union in this month’s referendum. As she enumerated her many grievances, I couldn’t help thinking of the scene in Monty Python’s “Life of Brian” in which a bunch of disaffected Judeans sit around, complaining about the Romans.

articles.headline: Saudi Oil Chief Khalid al-Falih Tells OPEC Changes Are Coming
articles.snippet: The message came after the cartel decide to maintain high levels of production, citing the recent rise in prices and signs that the global petroleum glut might be easing.
articles.abstract: The message came after the cartel decide to maintain high levels of production, citing the recent rise in prices and signs that the global petroleum glut might be easing.
articles.lead_paragraph: VIENNA — The new oil minister in Saudi Arabia, the de facto leader of the OPEC countries, had a message for the global market: Don’t expect us to influence the price of crude oil by adjusting supplies.
